column4: HI, could anyone help me with changing my graphics resolution? Im using nvidia 7600gs (if not misteaken) on ubuntu 8.10 with nvidia drivers installed.
then sudo nvidia-settings and see whats up
I see nvidia setings it gives me modes to choose from but not the one i need
is there a line in xorg.conf i can edit.. specifically.. i need some help with it as it doesnt seem to be changing
when trying to save config for higher res from nvidia settings it says something like "failed to parse to xorg.conf"
ok, i see my xorg.conf file in gedit.
so you need to find the screen section and modify it acordingly... admitidly this isn't my forte however its relatively simple
find the screen, copy an existing resolution and add it in there
dpkg-reconfigure gives me options but not for gfx only keyboard
I was just going to say remove /etc/X11/xorg.conf
im not sure if ubuntu would run without xorg
